00018 // atombuf -- collection of atoms
00019 
00020 typedef struct atombuf {
00021     long a_argc;
00022     t_atom a_argv[1];
00023 } t_atombuf;
00024 
00025 // wind -- wrapper for OS windows
00026 
00027 #if defined(MAC_VERSION) && !TARGET_API_MAC_CARBON
00028 #define WIND_USE_WINDOW_RECORD 1
00029 #else
00030 #define WIND_USE_WINDOW_RECORD 0
00031 #endif
00032 
00033 typedef struct wind
00034 {
00035     struct object w_ob;
00036     short w_x1;                 /* location of window */
00037     short w_x2;
00038     short w_y1;
00039     short w_y2;
00040     short w_xoffset;                /* scroll offsets */
00041     short w_yoffset;
00042     short w_scrollgrain;            /* scroll grain in pixels */
00043     short w_refcount;               /* reference count */
00044     char w_vis;                 /* visible */
00045     char w_titled;              /* has a title */
00046     char w_grow;                    /* has a grow region */
00047     char w_close;               /* has a close region */
00048     char w_scrollx;             /* has an x scroll region */
00049     char w_scrolly;             /* has a y scroll region */
00050     char w_dirty;               /* dirty flag (can save) */
00051     char w_scratch;             /* scratch flag -- don't complain on close */
00052     char w_bin;                 /* binary save */
00053     char w_font;                /* text font */
00054     char w_fsize;               /* font size */
00055     char w_fontindex;           /* font index (0 = 9 points, 7 = 24 points)  */
00056 #if WIND_USE_WINDOW_RECORD
00057     WindowRecord w_wind;
00058 #endif
00059         /* (end of public region) */
00060     short w_vsmax;              /* vertical scroll max */
00061     ControlHandle w_vscroll;
00062     short w_hsmax;              /* horizontal scroll max */
00063     ControlHandle w_hscroll;
00064     void *w_assoc;              /* associated object */
00065     method w_idle;              /* window idle function */
00066     char w_name[80];            /* filename = window title */
00067     short w_vol;                    /* file volume number (working directory) */
00068     short  w_proc;              /* window proc id (0 = normal) */
00069     char w_keeptitle;           /* set window title on saveas */
00070     char w_canon;               /* slot in canonical list of locations */
00071     char w_silentgrow;          /* has invisible grow region -- don't draw icon */
00072     char w_color;               /* try to make color window if you can */
00073     char w_bits;                /* number of bits (i.e. 2 for b&w) */
00074     char w_divscrollx;          /* divided horiz scroll bar */
00075     char w_zoom;                /* has zoom rect */
00076     short w_realfont;               /* real font in 16 bits */
00077     short w_hsleft;             /* left of scroll bar */
00078     Rect w_oldsize;
00079     short w_oldproc;
00080     char w_select;              /* always select on click */
00081     char w_frame;               /* special 'frame' mode */
00082     long w_flags;               /* used by thispatcher window message */
00083     WindowPtr w_wptr;           // DDZ 6/11/98, contains pre-existing window or ptr to w_wind
00084     long w_local;               // window's memory stored locally
00085     Rect w_growbounds;          // optional grow bounds for a window
00086     char w_helper;              // is a helper (used by the Windows menu)
00087 } t_wind, Wind;
00088 
00089 /* definition of t_syswind */
00090 #if TARGET_API_MAC_CARBON || defined(WIN_VERSION)
00091 #define t_syswind   void *
00092 #else
00093 #define t_syswind   WindowPtr
00094 #endif
00095 
00096     /* flags for window object */
00097 #define WVIS        01      /* visible */
00098 #define WGROW       02      /* grow region */
00099 #define WSCROLLX    04      /* x scrollbar */
00100 #define WSCROLLY    010     /* y scrollbar */
00101 #define WCLOSE      020     /* close region */
00102 #define WKEEPT      040     /* keep window title away from saveas */
00103 #define WSGROW      0100    /* silent grow region */
00104 #define WCOLOR      0200    /* color window */
00105 #define WPATCHPROC  0400    /* patcher wdef */
00106 #define WSHADOWPROC 01000   /* shadow wdef */
00107 #define WDIVSCROLLX 02000   /* divided horizontal scroll bar (min 140 pixels) */
00108 #define WZOOM       04000   /* has a zoom box */
00109 #define WSELECT     010000  /* always select on click (disobey all windows active) */
00110 #define WFROZEN     020000  /* prevent "thispatcher window" messages */
00111 #define WFLOATING   040000  // floating window (OS 8.6 or higher)
00112 
00113 #define W_WIDTH(w) (w->w_x2 - w->w_x1)
00114 #define W_HEIGHT(w) (w->w_y2 - w->w_y1)
00115 #define SBARWIDTH   15
00116 #define DIVBARMIN   130
00117 
00118 #define ISMAXWINDOW(window) ((window->windowKind == userKind) && (window->refCon))
00119 
00120 /* event codes returned from patcher WDEF */
00121 
00122 #define inLock 9        /* lock on/off */
00123 #define inRock 10       /* midi on/off */
00124 #define inDock 11       /* dock on (eventually) */
00125 
00126 #define aaYes 1
00127 #define aaNo 2
00128 #define aaCancel 3
00129 
00130 #define C_ARROW     1
00131 #define C_WATCH     2
00132 #define C_IBEAM     3
00133 #define C_HAND      4
00134 #define C_CROSS     5
00135 #define C_PENCIL    6
00136 #define C_GROW      8

00139 // ed -- the text editor window
00140 
00141 #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00142 typedef struct ed
00143 {
00144     struct object   e_ob;
00145     TEHandle        e_teh;
00146     int             e_nlines;
00147     Point           e_origin;
00148     struct wind     *e_wind;
00149     ProcPtr         e_docClik;
00150     struct object   *e_assoc;   /* <z1> associated object */
00151 } Ed, t_ed;
00152 #endif /* MAC_VERSION */
00153 
00154 #ifdef WIN_VERSION
00155 typedef struct ed
00156 {
00157     struct object   e_ob;
00158     void            *e_teh;     // will be 0
00159     short           e_nlines;
00160     Point           e_origin;   // not used
00161     struct wind     *e_wind;
00162     HWND            e_docClick;
00163     struct object   *e_assoc;   /* <z1> associated object */
00164     WNDPROC         e_wproc;
00165     HWND            e_sbhorz;
00166     HWND            e_sbvert;
00167 
00168 } t_ed;
00169 #endif /* WIN_VERSION */

00171 // menuinfo: structure to control which menu items to enable, used in chkmenu message to a window
00172 
00173 typedef struct menuinfo 
00174 {
00175     short i_cut;
00176     short i_paste;
00177     short i_dup;
00178     short i_save;
00179     short i_pastepic;
00180     short i_edit;
00181     short i_range;
00182     short i_lineup;
00183     short i_fixwidth;
00184     short i_size;
00185     short i_hide;
00186     short i_show;
00187     short i_selectall;
00188     short i_find;
00189     short i_findagain;
00190     short i_replace;
00191     short i_print;
00192     short i_font;
00193     short i_color;
00194     short i_savecoll;
00195     short i_noclick;
00196     short i_respond;
00197     short i_front;
00198     short i_back;
00199     short i_lockbg;
00200     short i_showbg;
00201     short i_showfg; 
00202     short i_includebg;
00203     short i_excludebg;
00204     short i_coloritem;
00205     short i_setorigin;
00206     short i_restoreorigin;
00207     short i_name;
00208     short i_showconnections;
00209     short i_showpal;
00210     short i_pastereplace;
00211 } Menuinfo, t_menuinfo;

00213 // zll: used in a funbuff
00214 
00215 typedef struct zll      /* doubly linked list */
00216 {                                           /* note:  no obj header  */
00217     long    z_x;
00218     long    z_y;
00219     struct zll *z_next;
00220     struct zll *z_prev;
00221 } t_zll,Zll;
00222 
00223 // funbuff: the structure of a funbuff object
00224 
00225 typedef struct funbuff
00226 {
00227     t_object f_obj;
00228     void *f_outlet;
00229     void *f_outlet1;
00230     void *f_outlet2;
00231     t_zll f_head;       /* head of double linked list of function elements */
00232     t_zll *f_foot;      /* foot in the door pointer for list  */
00233     long f_gotoDelta;       /* used by goto and next */
00234     long f_selectX;         /* selected region start   */
00235     long f_selectW;         /* selected region width   */
00236     t_symbol *f_sym;    /* filename */
00237     long f_y;               /* y-value from inlet */
00238     char f_yvalid;          /* flag that y has been set since x has */
00239     char f_embed;           /* flag for embedding funbuff values in patcher */
00240 } t_funbuff,Funbuff;
00241 
00242 // numerical structure, used in tables and available for externs that make windows
00243 
00244 #define N_HILITE 1
00245 #define N_RIGHT 2
00246 #define N_LEFT  4
00247 #define N_FRAME 8
00248 #define N_CLIP 16
00249 #define N_ENDTRACK 32
00250 #define N_BOLD 64
00251 #define N_FREE 128
00252 
00253 typedef struct num {
00254     t_tinyobject n_ob;
00255     long n_max,n_min,n_val;
00256     void *(*n_draw)();
00257     void *(*n_track)();
00258     void *(*n_inc)();
00259     Rect n_outline;
00260     Point n_start;
00261     int n_hilite;
00262     int n_font,n_fsize;
00263     long n_flags;
00264     void *n_arg;
00265     GrafPtr n_port;
00266 } t_numerical, Numerical;
00267 
00268 #define DEFSIZE 128     /* default size 128 elements */
00269 #define DEFRANGE 128    /* range 0-127 */
00270 #define ELEM long   /* table element type */
00271 
00272 // tabwind: the structure associated with a table window
00273 
00274 typedef struct tabwind
00275 {
00276     t_object w_ob;
00277     t_wind *w_wind;
00278     t_symbol *w_sym;
00279     ELEM **w_tab;
00280     long w_size;        /* size of actual table */
00281     long w_range;       /* editable range (y values) */
00282     long w_xoff;        /* x-value of first point displayed */
00283     long w_yoff;        /* y-value of top line */
00284     long w_xshift;      /* x-shift for displaying */
00285     long w_yshift;      /* y-shift */
00286     long w_xzoom;       /* x zoom */
00287     long w_yzoom;       /* y zoom */
00288     long w_cliprange;   /* range, anded to be 0 mod 1 << w_xzoom */
00289     long w_dpoints;     /* display points (size >> xshift rounded up) */
00290     long w_dragx;       /* previous x-value changed by dragging */
00291     long w_selstart;    /* starting sample of selected region (inclusive) */
00292     long w_selend;      /* ending sample of selected region (exclusive) */
00293     long w_saveno;      /* <a> added; serial number of last time saved to prevent duplicates */
00294     void *w_clock;      /* <a> clock to delay updating */
00295     void *w_qelem;      /* <a> qelem to queue updating to low pri */
00296     short w_xdisp;      /* number of points displayed */
00297     short w_ydisp;      /* number of y-values displayed */  
00298     char w_signed;      /* flag for signed display */
00299     char w_clkset;      /* <a> flag indicating clock is already set */
00300     char w_selmode;     /* tool 0 = select,1 = move,2 = line,3 = pencil */
00301     long w_xwas;        /* last x value legended */
00302     long w_ywas;        /* last x value legended */
00303     short w_xcenter;        /* last x point legend drawn at */
00304     short w_ycenter;        /* last y point legend drawn at */
00305     Point w_scroll;     /* last known scroll values, a la Patcher */
00306     char w_ylegmode;    /* 0 for Y legend as numbers,
00307                             1 for notes.  w_signed turns this off */
00308     char w_embed;       /* save it in a patcher */
00309     char w_crossguide;  /* show cross guide */
00310     char w_act;         /* activated? */
00311     long w_vwas;        /* last value legended */
00312     struct num *w_numrange; /* range numerical */
00313     struct num *w_numsize;  /* size numerical */
00314     struct table *w_reftab; /* list of reference tables */
00315     struct object *w_client;    /* send "tabchanged" message when table is changed */
00316     short w_xscale;     /* scrollbar scaling when values > 16 bits */
00317     short w_yscale;
00318 } t_tabwind, Tabwind;
00319 
00320 // user interface object structures
00321 
00322 // the box is used by patcher user interface objects
00323 
00324 typedef struct box
00325 {
00326     t_object b_ob;
00327 
00328     short b_inlet:1;            /* this box is an inlet */
00329     short b_outlet:1;           /* this box is an outlet */
00330     short b_textdirty:1;        /* text has been changed */
00331     short b_drawfirstin:1;  /* draw inlet for the real object */
00332     short b_outline:1;      /* draw the box */
00333     short b_drawn:1;            /* has been drawn */
00334     short b_spooled:1;      /* is spooled for drawing */
00335     short b_growy:1;            /* can grow in y direction */
00336     unsigned short b_inset:3;   /* top-and-bottom inset for text */
00337     short b_selected:1;     /* on if selected */
00338     unsigned short b_color:4;   /* index into palette (default 0) */
00339     unsigned short b_fsize; /* font size */
00340     short b_fontindex;      /* font index (get from window) */
00341     short b_growboth:1;     /* can grow independently in both directions */
00342     short b_ignorelockclick:1; /* ignore clicks if patcher is locked (be "transparent") */
00343     short b_hidden:1;           /* hide box on lock */
00344     short b_nogrow:1;           /* don't grow at all */
00345     short b_hilited:1;      /* hilited, typeable object */
00346     short b_pending:1;      /* typing is pending */
00347     short b_hiliteable:1;       /* hiliteable object */
00348     short b_nofloatinsp:1;      /* don't show a floating inspector */
00349     short b_saveselect:1;       /* save select state when window is not active */
00350     short b_undo:2;         /* undo bit */
00351     short b_bogus:1;            /* box's bogus bit--patcher creates its inlets/outlets on connect */
00352     short b_checkinvis:1;       /* check when invizzing */
00353     short b_visible:1;      /* for vnewobj patchers, is box visible? */
00354     short b_drawinlast:1;       /* used by vnewobj, inlet, outlet to draw inlets/outlets */
00355     short b_dynamic:1;
00356     short b_temp2:1;            // used by bagline/saveline
00357     short b_ignoreclick:1;  /* user setting for ignoring a lock click */
00358     short b_background:1;   // part of background
00359     short b_transparent:1;
00360     short b_clipaware:1;
00361     short b_temp3:1;
00362     short b_unused:3;       /* extra space for future bits */
00363     short b_temp;                   /* temporary space */
00364     struct box *b_upd;      /* used in saving */
00365     Rect b_rect;                    /* location */
00366     struct box *b_next;             /* next box in patcher */
00367     struct patcher *b_patcher;      /* owning patcher */
00368     void *b_firstin;                /* first inlet if nonzero */
00369     void *b_binbuf;                 /* contained message in binary */
00370     union
00371     {
00372         void *b_vpout;      /* patchoutlet in this patcher's visobj */
00373         void *b_vpin;       /* patchinlet in this patcher's visobj */
00374         void *b_teh;        /* text editor handle */
00375     } b_un;
00376 } t_box, Box;
00377 
00378 // box flags
00379 
00380 #define F_DRAWFIRSTIN   1       /* draw first inlet */
00381 #define F_GROWY         2       /* can grow in y direction by dragging */
00382 #define F_NODRAWBOX     4       /* don't draw the box  */
00383 #define F_MOVING        8
00384 #define F_DRAWN         16
00385 #define F_GROWBOTH      32      /* can grow independently in both x and y */
00386 #define F_IGNORELOCKCLICK 64    /* box should ignore a click if patcher is locked */
00387 #define F_NOGROW        128
00388 #define F_HILITE        256
00389 #define F_DRAWINLAST    512     /* draw inlets after update method */
00390 #define F_TRANSPARENT   1024
00391 #define F_SAVVY         2048
00392 #define F_BACKGROUND    4096
00393 #define F_NOFLOATINSPECTOR 8192 // no floating inspector window
00394 
00395 // clipregion message
00396 
00397 #define CLIPRGN_REGION 0
00398 #define CLIPRGN_RECT 1
00399 #define CLIPRGN_EMPTY 2
00400 #define CLIPRGN_COMPLEX 3
00401 
00402 // other constants
00403 
00404 #define POX 10  /* patcher outlet width and height */
00405 #define POY 3
00406 #define SIZE1 15    /* frequently used control dimensions */
00407 #define SIZE2 50
00408 #define UNIT 256
00409 #define USHIFT 8
00410 
00411 // font info for a patcher during save
00412 
00413 typedef struct _fontinfo
00414 {
00415     t_symbol *f_name;
00416     short f_number;
00417     double f_size;
00418     long f_reserved;
00419 } t_fontinfo;
00420 
00421 // the patcher
00422 
00423 enum {
00424     PATCHER_WILLFRAME = 0,
00425     PATCHER_WILLFLAGS,
00426     PATCHER_WILLSIZE,
00427     PATCHER_WILLCLOSE,
00428     PATCHER_WILLGROW,
00429     PATCHER_WILLZOOM,
00430     PATCHER_WILLFLOAT,
00431     PATCHER_WILLCOUNT,
00432     PATCHER_WILLNOMAD
00433 };
00434 
00435 typedef struct patcher
00436 {
00437     t_object p_ob;
00438     t_wind *p_wind;     /* window object */
00439     void *p_vnewobj;            /* containing box if any */
00440     void *p_instr;              /* associated instrument if any */
00441                         /* graphing */
00442     struct box *p_boxupd;       /* list of boxes to redwraw */
00443     void *p_lineunused;         /* $ddz -- no longer used, lines to redraw */
00444     long p_whenupd;             /* when to redraw */
00445                         /* selection and editing */
00446     void *p_updclock;           /* update clock */
00447     struct box *p_seltext;      /* if != 0, box to send keys to */
00448                         /* other */
00449     struct box *p_box;          /* the boxes */
00450     struct patchline *p_line;   /* the lines */
00451     Rect p_span;                /* rectangle spanned by all boxes */
00452     Point p_scroll;             /* last known scroll values */
00453     void *p_pushed;             /* patcher we pushed to name this one "Pat" */
00454     struct box *p_hilited;      /* "operational selection" */
00455     void *p_parent;             /* parent object (eg. pr-type thing) */
00456     short p_nselect;                /* number of selected boxes */  
00457     short p_vol;                    /* filesys volume to look up classes in */
00458     char p_lock;                /* on if the patcher is locked */
00459     char p_dirtybar;            /* on if the edit bar needs drawing */
00460     char p_noedit;              /* can't unlock this patcher */
00461     char p_enabled;             /* is MIDI enabled? */
00462     short p_pasted:1;               /* just did a paste (don't edit text) */
00463     short p_freed:1;                /* being freed, no need to redraw */
00464     short p_remote:1;               /* has remote version */
00465     short p_bghidden:1;             /* has host version */
00466     short p_traceactive:1;      /* making patcher active during trace */
00467     short p_tl:1;                   /* timeline subpatcher? */
00468     short p_fghidden:1;
00469     short p_paranoid:1;         /* was "no unlock" variable true when this file read in? */
00470     char p_cursor;              /* index of the user interface object of the cursor */
00471     char p_loadbanged;          /* have I been loadbanged already? */
00472     char p_color;               /* is this patcher in color (mult devices only) == 4 for 16, 8 otherwise */
00473     void *p_hiout;              /* hilited outlet */
00474     struct box *p_hibox;        /* hilited outlet's box */
00475     void *p_okhook;             /* object to send okclose message to */
00476     long p_search;              /* search info field */
00477     void *p_assoc;              /* object (eg. lib) associated with this patcher */
00478     void *p_undo;               /* undo object */
00479     short p_deffont;                /* default font for new objects */
00480     short p_defsize;                /* default font size for new objects */
00481     void *p_collective;         /* collective record if this patcher comes from one */
00482     short p_idleicon;           /* icon last assisted in idle */
00483     char p_savewindow;          /* save window info in patcher */
00484     char p_filler;              /* while we're adding fields... */
00485     void *p_vartab;             // script variable table
00486     Point p_origin;             // current relative offset of the 0-0 point, patcher will be opened with this set to 0,0
00487     void *p_bpushed;            // previous box before patcher was made
00488     Rect *p_invalrect;          // when box_invalnow is happening, what's the clip rect?
00489     short p_hideconnections:1;  // connections hidden/uneditable
00490     short p_hidepalette:1;
00491     short p_windowchanging:1;   // currently inside window exec
00492     short p_unused2:5;
00493     long p_findindex;
00494     short p_defcolor;           // default color for new objects
00495     void *p_savehilitebox;      // saved hilited box (rather than bit in box)
00496     short p_bglocked:1;         // is patcher background locked?
00497     short p_scriptmakingnew:1;          // is patcher background locked?
00498     void *p_pvartab;            // pvar table
00499     RGBColor p_bgcolor;         // background color (default white)
00500     void *p_printport;          // printing port if in use
00501     char p_willwinds[PATCHER_WILLCOUNT];
00502     Rect p_willframe;
00503     t_fontinfo *p_setfont;
00504     short p_saveboxoffsetx;     // used during the patcher loading process to preserve paste offset
00505     short p_saveboxoffsety;
00506 } t_patcher, Patcher;
00507

00510     #pragma pack(pop)
00511 #elif C74_PRAGMA_STRUCT_PACK

00515 #ifdef __cplusplus
00516 }
